name: Feather Icons
description: This plugin allows you to add Feather icons to your Publii site.
author: TidyCustoms

config.name: separator
config.note: To add icons to your site, insert a shortcode like [fi=bell] anywhere, including in posts, pages, menus, footers, etc., where 'bell' is the icon's name. This will use the default icon settings from the plugin's configuration. You can also use an extended shortcode format to override these settings: [fi=bell size=90px color=#ff0000 class=custom-class aria-hidden=true]. For a list of icons, visit Feather Icons website. Detailed instructions and examples are available in the plugin documentation.

config.name: iconSizeUnit
config.label: Icon size unit
config.note: Select the unit for the icon's size

config.name: iconStrokeWidth
config.label: Stroke width
config.note: The icon's stroke width in pixels

config.name: nonScalingStroke
config.label: Non-scaling stroke
config.note: Enable this option to prevent the stroke width from changing when scaling the icon, ensuring consistent stroke appearance regardless of size.

config.name: iconVerticalAlign
config.label: Icon vertical align
config.note: Select the vertical alignment for the icons

config.name: iconVerticalAlignCustom
config.label: Custom vertical align value
config.note: Specify a custom vertical align value (e.g., -5px, 0.5em, 5%)

config.name: ariaHiddenDefault
config.label: ARIA hidden attribute
config.note: Set default value for 'aria-hidden' attribute. If set to false, the attribute is not added to the SVG icon markup.

config.name: iconLoadingMethod
config.label: Icon loading method
config.note: Choose how the icons should be loaded on the production site. The 'Use SVG map file' method involves loading SVG maps from a dedicated file, providing enhanced organization but potentially increasing page load times due to an additional server request. Alternatively, the 'Use inline SVG code' approach embeds SVG directly within the HTML, resulting in faster page loading by eliminating the need for this additional request but potentially increasing the overall code size of your site.
